channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Protests against Israel's war in Gaza rattle colleges across the US
item.description: Colleges and universities held graduation ceremonies this weekend as pro-Palestinian protests continued on campuses across the US. Follow for live updates.

item.title: Israel-Gaza live updates: Warnings issued to 100,000 as Israel weighs Rafah invasion
item.description: More than six months after Hamas terrorists invaded Israel on Oct. 7, the Israeli military continues its bombardment of the neighboring Gaza Strip.

item.title: Israel tells Gazans in parts of eastern Rafah to evacuate
item.description: Israel's military has told people in eastern Rafah to "evacuate immediately," Follow for live updates.

item.title: Russia announces nuclear weapon drills after angry exchange with Western officials
item.description: Russia's Defense Ministry says it plans to hold drills simulating the use of tactical nuclear weapons

item.title: May 5, 2024 - US campus protests
item.description: Colleges and universities are holding graduation ceremonies as pro-Palestinian protests continue on campuses across the US.

item.title: Nervous about falling behind the GOP, Democrats are wrestling with how to use AI
item.description: The Biden campaign and top Democrats are wrestling with how best to use artificial intelligence, exposing the partyâ€™s anxiety over falling behind Republicans in the race to deploy technology that could transform the future of elections

item.title: May 4, 2024 - Campus protest updates
item.description: Some colleges have canceled or modified graduation ceremonies as more than 2,000 people have been arrested on campuses since April 18, as pro-Palestinian protests ripples across the US.

item.title: Body found in home of man who allegedly attempted to shoot pastor, police say
item.description: A church service in Pennsylvania came to a terrifying halt on Sunday when authorities say a man pulled a gun on the pastor.

item.title: May 4, 2024 - Israel-Gaza news
item.description: Hostage and truce talks have resumed in Cairo as war rages in Gaza.

item.title: Civil rights leader Daisy Bates and singer Johnny Cash to replace Arkansas statues
item.description: Arkansas is set to replace the statues of two obscure figures from its history that have represented the state at the U.S. Capitol with contemporary figures
